upnp_enabled.description: If true, UPnP & NAT-PMP discovery will be enabled and port mapping will be established.

listen_address.description: Listen address for external interface. This should be publicly accessible

port.description: Local port used for incoming sync connections. If behind NAT this may differ from the 'external_port' value.

external_port.description: Listen port for external sync connections. This must be the WAN-facing port number (depending on NAT configuration this may be different from 'port' value above).

acceptors.description: Number of acceptors in listening pool

first_ping_timeout.description: Maximum time for receiving a ping in miliseconds

noise_hs_timeout.description: Maximum time for noise handshake in miliseconds

close_timeout.description: Maximum time for the peer to close a connection cleanly

max_inbound.description: Maximum number of inbound connections after which inbound connections are temporary (only used for a single ping)

max_gossip.description: Maximum number of peers to gossip blocks and transactions to

single_outbound_per_group.description: If the extra outbound connections should be to nodes from different address groups (IP netmask /16)

gossiped_peers_count.description: The number of peers sent in ping message

resolver_max_retries.description: Maximum number of retries at resolving the host name of untrusted peers.

resolver_backoff_times.description: Waiting time intervals (milliseconds) before each retry at resolving the host name of peers (both trusted and untrusted). Retries further to the length of the array reuse the last item of the array.

gossip_allowed_height_from_top.description: Allowed height difference from current top for incoming blocks (via gossip)

sync_allowed_height_from_top.description: Once own node is synced, reject sync blocks at least this far from the current top; 0 means disabled

resist_forks_from_start.description: If sync_allowed_height_from_top > 0, this is applied at startup

whitelist_file.description: The name of a block hash whitelist file (JSON format)

log_peer_connection_count_interval.description: Time (milliseconds) between logging info about connected peers

select_verified_peer_probability.description: Probability of selecting a peer from the verified pool.

max_update_lapse.description: Time (milliseconds) without a peer being updated after which it gets removed.

standby_times.description: Waiting time intervals (milliseconds) before each retry to connect to a peer. If there are more 'max_rejections' than elements in this list, the last retry time is used more than once.

max_rejections.description: The default maximum number of times a peer can get rejected. When reached, the peer is downgraded or removed (if not trusted).

peer_analytics.description: If enabled aggregates info about remote peers and exposes them via HTTP. Overrides max_inbound and max_outbound

allow_domains.description: List of domains that can access resources. Use '*' to allow all domains.

allow_headers.description: List of allowed headers to be used with requests (to be set in access-control-request-headers header in the response). Use '*' or do not set at all to allow all headers.

allow_methods.description: List of allowed methods allowed to be used when accessing resources (to be set in access-control-allow-methods header in the response).

max_age.description: Indicates for how many seconds the results of a preflight request can be cached (to be set in access-control-max-age header in the response).

listen_address.description: Listen address for external interface. This should be publicly accessible

port.description: Listen port for external HTTP interface.

acceptors.description: Number of acceptors in external pool

gas_limit.description: Maximum gas allowed to be available to a single dry-run call.

listen_address.description: Listen address for internal interface. This should not be publicly accessible

port.description: Listen port for internal HTTP interface.

acceptors.description: Number of acceptors in internal pool

debug_endpoints.description: Enable (true) debug api. Disabled (false) by default. Debug endpoints are defined by a tag in the Swagger API schema

dev.description: Development only API - for validation of client implementations. Should not be used in real life scenarios

obsolete.description: Old endpoints that will be removed

debug.description: Deprecated. See also 'http > internal > debug_endpoints' KILLME FIXME

enabled.description: Enable HTTP cache headers (ETag and Expire)

aged_blocks_time.description: Time (in seconds) after a block is considered aged. That is an Expire header is generated for such blocks API endpoints.

aged_blocks_cache_time.description: Time (in seconds) to cache aged blocks, the Expire header time relative to block creation time.

max_count.description: Max number of active state channel clients allowed on node

listen_address.description: Listen address for channels websocket interface.

port.description: Listen port for channels websocket interface.

dir.description: Location (directory) of the public/private key pair(s)

peer_password.description: Password used to encrypt the peer key-pair files

persist.description: If true, all changes to the chain are written to disk.

db_path.description: The directory where the chain is persisted to disk.

db_write_max_retries.description: Maximum number of retries for failing database write operations.

hard_forks.description: The consensus protocol versions with respective effective heights. Ignored if 'fork_management > network_id' has value 'ae_mainnet' or 'ae_uat'.

^[1-9][0-9]*$.description: Minimum height at which protocol is effective

consensus.description: The consensus algorithms used for validating blocks. Ignored if 'fork_management > network_id' has value 'ae_mainnet' or 'ae_uat'.

^[1-9][0-9]*$.description: Minimum height at which the given consensus algorithm gets activated. By default from genesis Cuckoo cycle based BitcoinNG is used.

name.description: The name of the consensus algorithm used at the given height

config.description: Configuration for the given consensus algorithm

protocol_beneficiaries_enabled.description: If true, the node will split rewards and send part to protocol_beneficiaries

items.description: Public keys belonging to protocol maintainers with reward shares (100 is 10%). If not set testnet or mainnet beneficiaries and shares will be used based on network_id configuration value. IMPORTANT: The value of this setting is under governance, thus it should not be changed without previous agreement within the configured network on doing so.

enabled.description: If true, node will perform garbage collection of account state, removing unrechable merkle patricia nodes and free some disk space

interval.description: How often (every `interval` block) should garbage collection run

history.description: How many blocks (back from the top) should be scanned for reachable hashes

autostart.description: If true, the node will start mining automatically.

attempt_timeout.description: Maximum time (milliseconds) for each attempt to mine a block with a specific nonce.

beneficiary.description: Public key of beneficiary account that will receive fees from mining on a node. Required when 'mining.autostart' is set to 'true'.

expected_mine_rate.description: Expected mine rate (milliseconds) between blocks. Used in governance.

micro_block_cycle.description: Expected rate (milliseconds) between micro-blocks. Used in governance.

min_miner_gas_price.description: Minimum gas price accepted by the miner

max_auth_fun_gas.description: Maximum gas allowed for GAMetaTx authentication function

beneficiary_reward_delay.description: Delay (in key blocks / generations) for getting mining rewards. Used in governance.

name_claim_bid_timeout.description: Blocks to wait until auction closes. Used in governance.

strictly_follow_top.description: If true, removes the risk of a race condition with eventual forking in fast mining context

edge_bits.description: Number of bits used for representing an edge in the Cuckoo Cycle problem. It affects both PoW generation (mining) and verification. WARNING: Changing this makes the node incompatible with the chain of other nodes in the network, do not change from the default unless you know what you are doing.

miners.description: Definitions of miners' configurations. If no miners are configured one miner is used as default, i.e. 'mean29-generic' executable without any extra args.

executable.description: Executable binary of the miner. Options are: "mean29-generic" (memory-intensive), "mean29-avx2" (memory-intensive, benefits from faster CPU supporting AVX2 instructions), "lean29-generic" (CPU-intensive, useful if memory-constrained), "lean29-avx2" (CPU-intensive, useful if memory-constrained, benefits from faster CPU supporting AVX2 instructions).

executable_group.description: Group of executable binaries of the miner.

extra_args.description: Extra arguments to pass to the miner executable binary. The safest choice is specifying no arguments i.e. empty string.

hex_encoded_header.description: Hexadecimal encode the header argument that is send to the miner executable. CUDA executables expect hex encoded header.

nice.description: DEPRECATED: Miner process priority (niceness) in a UNIX fashion. Higher `nice` means lower priority. Keep it unset to inherit parent process priority.

repeats.description: Number of tries to do in each miner context - WARNING: it should be set so the miner process runs for 3-5s or else the node risk missing out on new micro blocks.

addressed_instances.description: Instances used by the miner in case of Multi-GPU mining. Numbers on the configuration list represent GPU devices that are to addressed by the miner.

miner.description: Deprecated way of configuring single miner. Please use 'mining > cuckoo > miners' and 'mining > cuckoo > edge_bits' instead. Note that this section CAN NOT be configured when either 'mining > cuckoo > miners' or 'mining > cuckoo > edge_bits' is set.

executable_group.description: Group of executable binaries of the miner.

executable.description: Executable binary of the miner. If the executable group is 'aecuckoo', the options are: "mean29-generic" (memory-intensive), "mean29-avx2" (memory-intensive, benefits from faster CPU supporting AVX2 instructions), "lean29-generic" (CPU-intensive, useful if memory-constrained), "lean29-avx2" (CPU-intensive, useful if memory-constrained, benefits from faster CPU supporting AVX2 instructions). For the other executable groups, please refer to the user documentation.

extra_args.description: Extra arguments to pass to the miner executable binary. The safest choice is specifying no arguments i.e. empty string.

edge_bits.description: Number of bits used for representing an edge in the Cuckoo Cycle problem. It affects both PoW generation (mining) and verification. WARNING: Changing this makes the node incompatible with the chain of other nodes in the network, do not change from the default unless you know what you are doing.

hex_encoded_header.description: Hexadecimal encode the header argument that is send to the miner executable. CUDA executables expect hex encoded header.

nice.description: DEPRECATED: Miner process priority (niceness) in a UNIX fashion. Higher `nice` means lower priority. Keep it unset to inherit parent process priority.

repeats.description: Number of tries to do in each miner context - WARNING: it should be set so the miner process runs for 3-5s or else the node risk missing out on new micro blocks.

instances.description: Number of miner instances in case of Multi-GPU mining.

hwm.description: Controls the overload protection in the logs. Default=50.

level.description: Sets the level of logging in the default, mining, cuckoo and sync logs.

host.description: Hostname to use when reporting to the statsd daemon

port.description: Port number of the (typically) statsd daemon.

reconnect_interval.description: How often (in ms) to try reconnecting to the daemon

rules.description: Filter rules guiding logging/sending of metrics. The provided search patterns are applied to existing metrics, and the related 'actions' control whether to 'log' the metric data to disk, 'send' it to the cloud, or neither. The default is to do both, i.e. 'log,send' for all 'ae.epoch.**' metrics.

actions.description: What to do with matching metrics.

active.description: If true, the monitoring will start.

autostart.description: If true, the monitoring will start posting transactions.

amount.description: Amount to set up in monitoring spend transaction.

interval.description: How often (in ms) to try post monitoring transaction.

ttl.description: Number of blocks before tx is garbage collected.

privkey.description: Private key of transaction publisher serialized as signature.

load_levels.description: Overload sampler configurations. These monitor potential pain points in the system for indications of overload.

size.description: Number of transactions in the mempool

regulators.description: Queues regulating the load in a node. Each queue may have a combination of 'rate', 'counter', 'max_size' and 'max_time' parameters. Set a parameter to 0 if you want it to have no effect.

network_id.description: Identification of the network in case of hard forks.

enabled.description: Indicates whether the node should follow the signalling result or stay with the current protocol.

signalling_start_height.description: Height at which signalling period starts.

signalling_end_height.description: Height at which signalling period ends.

signalling_block_count.description: Count of the key blocks in signalling period necessary for the fork to take effect.

info_field.description: Pseudorandom number (part of key block) used by the miners indicating which fork they support.

version.description: Version of the chain in case of a successful fork.

items.description: Public key receiving pool reward to percent share map.

dir.description: Directory of the public/private key pair used for signing of the payout contract call (either relative to aestratum priv directory or absolute). This account holds mining rewards which are scheduled for redistribution to miners. It is unexpected that this account should hold any substantial amount of tokens (in fiat value) - it would mean redistributions aren't working. The pool operator should ensure the node operates in trusted environment.
